poem:
Title: Silhouettes in Cyber Court

Digital voices, pleading for their day,
In high court of liberty and law.
Stitches of argument, spun in the gray
Of moderation's unending sprawl.
Freedom's coin toss, a celestial play,
Where silence echoes in the webbed hall.
Yet, sometimes lost in disarray,
Is the thought that binds us all.
